subs.text: There was an article in the NYT how Yoko Ono and the break up of the Beatles. The story really never gets to the point, but
The Beatles broke up because they were tired and sweet loving people, in way over their heads, and wanted some semblance of normalcy in their lives.
They stayed together so long because they were best friends, and loved making music together, but when their manager died, it fell apart.

All the wives were there at one time, even Paul McCartney's daughter. The biggest annoyance was the producer who forced them to do a concert, which was ugly and unnecessary, even in its scaled down form.
I suggest watching Eight Days a Week, a Beatles documentary about their touring days for an idea of the hell they emerged from. It's on Hulu.
